summary: Deteriorating health across the life course is a major societal burden, and effective therapeutics are lacking . Effective therapeutics of this type

Developmentally administered mtH<sub>2</sub>S (100 nM) improved life/health span vs. >2 <-sub>.S donor-mediated health span . mtH preserved aging mitochondrial structure, content and neuromuscular strength .

mitochondrial loss is one of the nine hallmarks of aging, and is the earliest detectable subcellular structural change during <em>C. elegans' aging . As such, therapies that exploit positive H<sub>2</sub>S effects on mitochondria represent an attractive antiaging strategy .
Lower doses of mitochondrion-targeted H<sub>2</sub>S (AP39) extend life span . Lower doses (100 nM) of mitochondrial-reserved H (AP38) extend the life span of C. elegans .

We compared mtH<sub>2</sub>S to a recently published life span and health span improving drug, rilmenidine, using our microfluidic “Nemalife” health span device . We found both compounds extended life span to similar degrees . Rilmendine also has no effect on neuromuscular health parameters in early life

Lower dose (100 nM) mitochondrion-targeted H<sub>2</sub>S maintains <em>C. elegans' maximal strength producing ability in later life (day 10 postadulthood), measured using our microfluidic . device .  The percentage of well-networked and moderately fragmented mitochondria during <em>C.C. is well-connected and well-networking . Thus, mtH<sub>2</sub>S improves mitochondrial integrity across age, which associates with health span maintenance .

The mechanisms governing health span extension are unknown, but the mechanisms governing longevity are unknown . We found that mtH2S (AP39) aging is significantly improved with mtH H (AP38) and for a longer duration . Tr>                                hsp-6                 Hsp- 6

RNAi knockdown prevented significant life span or health span extension . H<sub>2</sub>S regulated cellular redox homeostasis, in part through activation of the Nrf2 transcription factor and associated signaling pathway . PNAS study found lower mitochondrial superoxide levels during aging with adult mtH<sub>2</sub>S treatment . Health span was extended when mtH was delivered to adult animals .
Figure 4: Effects of age and mtH2S on the transcriptome of C. elegans . Figure 5: Age, age, age and gene expression . Figure 4 shows that age and age are related to gene abundance .

Two gene clusters (Clusters 3 and 13) that aligned to cytoskeletal structure, mitochondria, and general metabolism functional classes, displayed progressive expression declines with age . In both clusters, mtH2S administered from L1 failed to affect the age-related loss of gene expression . Conversely, adult-onset mtH sub A single transcription factor, elt-3, emerged as the putative regulator of both gene clusters . During wild-type aging, expression of .elt-5 and to regulate a large portion of age-related transcriptome changes .
H<sub>2</sub>S is a diatomic signaling molecule that promotes healthy aging in <em>C. elegans . The underlying mechanisms and therapeutic viability across the lifecourse remains unclear .
Of the 14 genes targeted for established roles in H<sub>2</sub>S biology, two clear functional themes emerged as mechanisms of mtH<sub>.2</Sub>S life span and health span extension .
Mitochondrial H<sub>2</sub>S is, therefore, a viable adult-onset antiaging therapeutic opportunity . Mitochondria S-extended health span, but not life span .

Peroxisomes are essential for proper functioning of all cell types, compartmentalizing enzymes regulating, e.g., fatty acid β-oxidation and hydrogen peroxide metabolism . Several facets of peroxisome dysfunction cause accelerated aging .

The comparably lower mtH <sub>2</sub>S donor doses (vs. nontargeted NaGYY4137; >3 orders of magnitude difference) required for aging health benefits . The lower donor doses required for the aging health benefit, combined with efficacy in adult animals and high conservation of associated mechanisms

The strains used in this study were N2 wild-type and CB5600 <em>CB5600 (ccIs4251 (Pmyo-3::Ngfp-lacZ; Pmyo_3::MtgFP) strains . The first day of adulthood was considered as Day 0 for all experiments . L1 worms synchronized by gravity floatation were  The overall proportion of mitochondrial or myofibrillar classifications was obtained by normalizing to the total muscle cell count within each treatment condition from 30 to 60 animals per time point) across two biological replicates .

All RNAi experiments were performed using age synchronized L1 larval stage animals by gravity flotation . Animals were transferred to fresh OP50 plates every 48 h to remove progeny and prevent population starvation . Citrate synthase activity (CS) was measured in isolated mitochondrial pellets .  120 animals were picked into M9 buffer in 1.5 mL low-bind eppendorphs and washed three times with 1 mL sterile M9 to clear bacterial debris and progeny . Samples were snap-frozen in 40 µL M9 and stored at −80 °C until analysis (within 1 wk) Sulfide content was assessed as described previously .
